title: What exactly is a spot bitcoin ETF?
description: As many investors patiently await approval for a spot bitcoin ETF (BTC-USD) , some may still be wondering what exactly they're waiting for. Yahoo Finance Anchor Brad Smith has them covered as he explains exactly the spot bitcoin ETF is and how investors can capitalize on the opportunity. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Nicholas Jacobino

title: Bitcoin mining CEO calls ETF 'great entry point' for crypto
description: After a false report on Tuesday, crypto bulls and investment firms await the Securities and Exchange Commission's (SEC) ultimate decision on Wednesday over whether to approve issuances of a spot bitcoin ETF. Crypto companies, such as low-emission bitcoin miner CleanSpark (CLSK), are excited about the accessibility aspects a bitcoin ETF could offer for retail investors and institutional firms. CleanSpark CEO Zach Bradford joins Yahoo Finance Live to discuss the entryway into crypto a bitcoin ETF would provide, and crypto events that offer more opportunities for bitcoin miners. "There's a lot of institutional capital that's been sidelined due to the risks around it," Bradford says. "And the ETFs have now put up a system where they're going to hold it, they're going to manage some of those immediate risks around holding and custody of the bitcoin themselves." For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

title: It’s Deadline Day for an SEC Decision on Spot Bitcoin ETFs. Here’s What to Watch.
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission faces a final deadline Wednesday to rule on at least one of 11 applications for exchange-traded funds that hold bitcoin.  The decision is long awaited by cryptocurrency watchers—and the prospect that some or all of the applications will be approved has lately been seen as bullish for bitcoin.  There was some [drama late Tuesday](https://www.wsj.com/finance/currencies/sec-chair-denies-bitcoin-etf-has-been-approved-9a326e87): A message on social media said the SEC had approved the funds, before the agency quickly disavowed the post and said its account had been "compromised."
text: It’s Deadline Day for an SEC Decision on Spot Bitcoin ETFs. Here’s What to Watch.The Securities and Exchange Commission faces a final deadline Wednesday to rule on at least one of 11 applications for exchange-traded funds that hold bitcoin.  The decision is long awaited by cryptocurrency watchers—and the prospect that some or all of the applications will be approved has lately been seen as bullish for bitcoin.  There was some [drama late Tuesday](https://www.wsj.com/finance/currencies/sec-chair-denies-bitcoin-etf-has-been-approved-9a326e87): A message on social media said the SEC had approved the funds, before the agency quickly disavowed the post and said its account had been "compromised."

title: Bitcoin Edges Lower Ahead of SEC Decision
description: Bitcoin traded around $45,000 on Wednesday ahead of an expected decision from the Securities and Exchange Commission to approve or reject the listing of exchange-traded funds holding the cryptocurrency.  + On Tuesday, bitcoin spiked to near $48,000 after the SEC's official X account incorrectly posted that it had approved bitcoin ETFs, a message the agency [quickly disavowed](https://www.wsj.com/finance/currencies/sec-chair-denies-bitcoin-etf-has-been-approved-9a326e87?mod=hp_lead_pos4) and said was unauthorized.  + Bitcoin, the leading cryptocurrency, was down nearly 4% over the last 24 hours, according to CoinDesk.

title: Spot bitcoin ETF: Why people may not be rushing in to buy
description: Scores of Wall Street investors are patiently waiting to hear from the Securities and Exchange Commission on a spot bitcoin ETF approval (BTC-USD) , especially after the SEC's X.com account was compromised Tuesday afternoon, releasing a false statement about the pending decision. With so much attention on this topic, have the floodgates been open for bitcoin? Will investment in the cryptocurrency boom or will the buzz pass on by? Steve McClurg, Valkyrie Funds Chief Investment Officer, joins Yahoo Finance to give insight into the compromised SEC account, the decision from the SEC, and what it could mean for bitcoin going forward. McClurg explains how this could be a dam-breaking moment: "We launched a bitcoin futures ETF two years ago and we saw kind of a dam break at that point in time, where about a billion and a half dollars went into bitcoin ETFs, or bitcoin futures ETFs, for a period of about three days...I don't think it's going to be a dam-breaking moment like it was then, I think this is going to be a lot slower, will will probably see about $10 to $25 billion over the course of a year or two." For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Nicholas Jacobino

title: Crypto investors await today's SEC decision on bitcoin ETFs
description: On Tuesday, the Securities and Exchange Commission's (SEC) X account was reportedly compromised as it issued a false report of approving a spot bitcoin ETF. Wednesday, January 10 (today) is the deadline date for the SEC's decision on bitcoin ETFs. Bitcoin (BTC-USD) hovers just above $45,000 Wednesday morning. Yahoo Finance's Julie Hyman joins the Live show to comment on the situation and weigh the benefits and risks tied to pending bitcoin ETFs, including crypto volatility and ETF fees. For more expert insight and the latest market action, click here to watch this full episode of Yahoo Finance Live. Editor's note: This article was written by Luke Carberry Mogan.

title: UPDATE 2-Egypt's dollar bonds rally after Yellen signals support
description: Egypt's sovereign dollar bonds rallied more than 1.6 cents on Wednesday after U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen pledged support for the economy of the North African country that is under pressure to deliver bigger reforms.  All of Egypt's dollar bonds rallied, with the March 2024 maturity bid at 98 cents on the dollar, Tradeweb data showed.  Gergely Urmossy, emerging markets strategist at Societe Generale, said relatively cheap Eurobond valuations could be attracting investors, particularly after Yellen's comments and as Egyptian authorities advance talks with the International Monetary Fund to expand a $3 billion loan programme.
text: UPDATE 2-Egypt's dollar bonds rally after Yellen signals supportEgypt's sovereign dollar bonds rallied more than 1.6 cents on Wednesday after U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen pledged support for the economy of the North African country that is under pressure to deliver bigger reforms.  All of Egypt's dollar bonds rallied, with the March 2024 maturity bid at 98 cents on the dollar, Tradeweb data showed.  Gergely Urmossy, emerging markets strategist at Societe Generale, said relatively cheap Eurobond valuations could be attracting investors, particularly after Yellen's comments and as Egyptian authorities advance talks with the International Monetary Fund to expand a $3 billion loan programme.

title: Rupee extends rising streak into sixth day on dollar inflows
description: The Indian rupee recouped early losses to end higher for a sixth consecutive session on likely foreign inflows.  "Dollar inflows have kept the rupee the top performer among Asian currencies," Dilip Parmar, a foreign exchange research analyst at HDFC Securities, said.  "We will have to see if the move is sustainable given considering how the RBI (Reserve Bank of India) has absorbed such inflows in the past."
text: Rupee extends rising streak into sixth day on dollar inflowsThe Indian rupee recouped early losses to end higher for a sixth consecutive session on likely foreign inflows.  "Dollar inflows have kept the rupee the top performer among Asian currencies," Dilip Parmar, a foreign exchange research analyst at HDFC Securities, said.  "We will have to see if the move is sustainable given considering how the RBI (Reserve Bank of India) has absorbed such inflows in the past."

title: Dollar trades in tight range ahead of key U.S. inflation release
description: The U.S. dollar edged lower Wednesday, trading in a tight range with traders on edge before key U.S. inflation data that could influence the future path of interest rates.  The dollar has rebounded from December’s 2% fall as the traders have chosen the new year to reassess the likely speed and magnitude of the interest rate cuts most expect the Federal Reserve to deliver in 2024.  The Fed's surprising dovish tilt in December has resulted in the market projecting around 150 basis points of cuts this year, but this is reliant on inflation continuing to retreat.
text: Dollar trades in tight range ahead of key U.S. inflation releaseThe U.S. dollar edged lower Wednesday, trading in a tight range with traders on edge before key U.S. inflation data that could influence the future path of interest rates.  The dollar has rebounded from December’s 2% fall as the traders have chosen the new year to reassess the likely speed and magnitude of the interest rate cuts most expect the Federal Reserve to deliver in 2024.  The Fed's surprising dovish tilt in December has resulted in the market projecting around 150 basis points of cuts this year, but this is reliant on inflation continuing to retreat.

title: Bitcoin ETFs: The Bear Case
description: Bitcoin exchange traded funds may not actually be approved, due to the SEC’s long-held concerns about market manipulation. And, if they are, they could change the nature of Bitcoin itself, to the detriment of Satoshi Nakamoto’s original vision, say critics.
text: Bitcoin ETFs: The Bear CaseBitcoin exchange traded funds may not actually be approved, due to the SEC’s long-held concerns about market manipulation. And, if they are, they could change the nature of Bitcoin itself, to the detriment of Satoshi Nakamoto’s original vision, say critics.
